meanings.definition: A type of knee-length cloak or coat.
meanings.sent1: She wore a roquelaures to keep warm in the chilly evening.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer showcased a collection of elegant roquelaures.
meanings.sent3: The roquelaures looked like capes from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: Her roquelaures billowed behind her as she walked, giving her an air of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The rich velvet of the roquelaures made them stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: Plural form of roquelaure, referring to multiple knee-length cloaks or coats.
meanings.sent1: The actors on stage were all dressed in colorful roquelaures.
meanings.sent2: In the vintage shop, you could find various roquelaures hanging on the racks.
meanings.sent3: The roquelaures piled up in the corner, creating a mountain of fabric.
meanings.sent4: The market was filled with vendors selling roquelaures of all styles and colors.
meanings.sent5: The children played dress-up, pretending to be knights in shining roquelaures.
